{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents suggest that using a small bore needle (Document 24) and an atraumatic needle (Document 0) can decrease the risk of post-dural puncture headache. The replacement of the stylet prior to the removal of the needle is also suggested as a preventive measure (Document 14). However, there is no clear evidence supporting the supplementation of fluids as an effective strategy to decrease the risk of post-dural puncture headache (Document 6).", "answer_choice": "C"}
